Funding my Education It is now time to deliver your presentation. It is important to
think carefully about the purpose of your presentation, which is
to outline the different ways in which further education may be
funded and the most cost effective methods for a variety of
different student career paths. It is also important to consider
your audience. You will need to make sure that the style of your presentation is
suitable and that you use a range of techniques to interest those
listening to you. Rhetorical questions, examples, case studies or
analogies are all helpful ways of retaining interest as well as
non-verbal forms of communication such as eye contact and
body language. Use an image - perhaps projected on an OHP - which will help
illustrate some of your main points. Design your presentation to
last approximately ten minutes. To do this you may need to
prepare cue cards to remind you of what to say next. These
should be just reminders, not a set of notes that you simply read
aloud. Did you speak clearly and adapt the style and content of
your presentation to suit your audience? Did you use a range of techniques to keep the attention of
your audience? Did you structure what you said to make it easy to follow? Did you use an image to illustrate a complex point? Â© MBA Publishing Ltd 2003 Comments or queries about this site? Contact Us .
